input2:
Patient reports he was feeling well at baseline when he presented to clinic appointment with Dr. Reports baseline SOB with walking, but reports that he is able to walk even a mile without stopping. Recently completed pulmonary rehab and did a 6-minute walk test, without any reported desaturation per patient. 

At clinic, he was found to desat on ambulation to 69% on RA, with associated nausea. Chart reports concurrent SOB though patient denies this. He was put on 2L NC, and after rest with supplemental O2, HR 70 with O2 sat 96% so he was taken off NC.  He reports having some LLE ankle pain for the past several days thought due to gout. No pain in calf or thigh.

Review of Partners records show: goal weight is 174-176 lbs.
Patient reports dry weight to be 175 lbs, which he is at 
currently.
input3:

+ HTN 
+ HLD 
+ CKD 
+ Acute appendicitis S/P appendectomy 
+ Gout  
+ hemoptysis

input5:
ADMISSION PHYSCIAL EXAMINATION:
===============================

VITALS:  97.6PO 127 / 76 69 18 93 Ra 
GENERAL: AOx3, NAD  
HEENT: Normocephalic, atraumatic. Pupils equal, round, and reactive bilaterally, extraocular muscles intact. Sclera anicteric and without injection. Dry MM, wearing dentures.   
NECK: supple, JVP at clavicle at 45 deg
CARDIAC: irregularly irregular, Audible S1 and S2. No murmurs appreciated.   
LUNGS: CTAB, no wheezing or rhonchi, no increased work of breathing.
ABDOMEN: Normal bowels sounds, non distended, soft, non-tender to deep palpation in all four quadrants. No organomegaly.EXTREMITIES: DP pulses bl. L ankle without obvious deformities, no erythema, no tenderness. 
SKIN: No rashes noted.  
NEUROLOGIC: A&Ox3, fluent speech, moving all extremities with purpose, no facial droop
